ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I've learned a lot about effective creative writing in a wide variety of forms and genres. I've learned how to have a bit more fun when it comes to writing.
I learned how to write a short story, poems and a dramatic piece. I learned about the different styles and techniques that can be used in each genre.
Basic creative writing skills and a great intro dive into poetry, prose, and drama!

I learned the rudiments of crafting fiction, poetry, and dramatic worksfrom basic structure to deeper considerations of dialogue, pacing, and playing with time and different styles of diction to create more dynamic pieces.
I learned a lot about creative writing and storytelling across different writing mediums!
reading and writing short fiction, poems, plays, workshopping, revising

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is a great course as it's pretty low stress and none of the work is really a hassle to do. It's easy to enjoy the work for this class. I don't really think it had a weakness. It was well organized and well taught. The guest speakers were great. The workshops were helpful. Great stuff!
This was such a wonderful class. Emily was amazing and so engaging. She was so great at creating conversation in class.
Only weakness I can think of is that you dont really get a lot of depth into any one area due to the timing of the course, but overall was still very enjoyable!

Strengths: fun, engaging, demanding, yet low-pressure workthe prompts really allow you to be creative and encourage you to take risks to develop your voice as a writer; classes are fun and rewardingyou learn a lot in a comfortable, friendly atmosphere. 

Weaknesses: none
I loved everything about this class!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to other students (and I already have). I think it's a great way to get your humanities requirement for someone who's not in the humanities and I think it's just a great class to explore creative writing for beginners and pros alike.
I would definitely recommend. It offers a great survey of multiple different types of creative writing genres and also helps create a portfolio to apply to other creative writing courses

This was one of my favorite classes at Yale. Emily is also now one of my favorite professors. She is so kind and really loves creative writing. It was a such a wonderful space to explore something completely new to me.

Yes, if they have the remotest interest in any type of fiction they will certainly get a lot out of this classthe work is a lot of fun and something you can really be proud of, and you gain a significant appreciation for other fictional works.

I would absolutely recommend this class to anyone, regardless of whether you have a lot of experience with creative writing or if you're just starting out. This class provides the opportunity to learn about creative writing in a low-stress and incredibly friendly and supportive environment, and by the end of it, you have a whole portfolio of work! I was in Professor Skilling's section, and it was wonderful!! Definitely take it with her if you can!

this was one of my favorite classes at yale. i felt safe to express myself and write without worrying about getting a certain grade and i felt myself learning how to love learning again. the only weakness is that it's over, i would take this class again and again if i could :)

No piece of creative writing that I could make in this recommendation would let you know how much I think you should take this course!! It's truly a gem at Yale. It is very accessible and working between the different mediums was really great. I'm sure all the sections are great, but I can't imagine anyone being a better teacher for this course than Emily. She gives such great feedback across all the different mediums and is just a light in the classroom. One of my favorite classes at Yale!
